content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nI used the command "google" with the query "Michigan trees characteristics" and received a list of helpful links from my computer. The website for the Michigan Department of Natural Resources provides information on Michigan\'s diverse range of fish, plants, trees, reptiles, amphibians, insects and mammals. The second link provides detailed information on identifying trees in Michigan, including more than 75 native species of trees. The third link explains that Michigan boasts around 100 tree species, with trees being the dominant life form and impacting everything that occurs in the forest.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.michigan.gov/dnr/education/michigan-species/plants-trees", "question": "What are the different types of trees found in Michigan and what are their unique characteristics?"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides information on various types of trees found in Michigan, including green beech, aspen, American basswood, American beech, paper birch, northern white cedar, wild black cherry, American chestnut, eastern cottonwood, balsam fir, shagbark hickory, eastern hemlock, American hornbeam, sugar maple, red oak, white oak, pawpaw, jack pine, red pine, eastern white pine, tulip poplar, eastern redbud, and tamarack. The text also includes descriptions and graphics of each tree's unique characteristics. \n \n Links: ['Skip to main content (https://www.michigan.gov/dnr/education/michigan-species/plants-trees#pagebody)', '\\n\\n\\n (https://www.michigan.gov/dnr)', '\\nDepartment of Natural Resources\\n (https://www.michigan.gov/dnr)', '\\n                                            Events\\n                                         (https://www.michigan.gov/dnr/things-to-do/calendar)', '\\n                                    Go to Things to do\\n                                    \\n (https://www.michigan.gov/dnr/things-to-do)']"}]
"""
